SENT.plain: We reported 2 patients with top of the basilar syndrome manifested by onset seizure
When he was sleeping, suddenly he gave a loud cry and went into convulsions
So he was brought to our hospital by ambulance
On admission, he had unconsciousness and left hemiplegia
When he was bathing, he lost his consciousness and brought to our hospital by ambulance
On admission, he had convulsion and tetraplegia
Both patients had convulsions and palsy when they had brain infarctions
Brain diffusion weighted MR image showed high intensity area in bilateral internal thalamus, brainstem and cerebellum and no high intensity area in cerebral cortex
We know well that Todd's palsy is palsy after convulsion, but vertebro-basilar occlusion also shows convulsion and palsy
Therefore attention should be paid in the case of the patients who had convulsion and palsy
